prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in physics would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in physics would. January 1, 2007 was a Monday. In 2007, how many Fridays are there?
gpt_response:
To determine how many Fridays occur in the year 2007, we must first understand the cyclical nature of the days of the week. The Gregorian calendar operates on a 400-year cycle, with each year containing 52 weeks and 1 or 2 additional days. 

In a non-leap year like 2007, there are 365 days, which is equivalent to 52 weeks and 1 day. This means that each day of the week will occur 52 times in a non-leap year, with the remaining day occurring an additional time. Since January 1, 2007 was a Monday, the day that occurs 52 times in 2007 will also be a Monday.

Therefore, Friday, being four days away from Monday, will occur 52 times in the year 2007 as well. So, there are a total of 52 Fridays in the year 2007.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. In a non-leap year like 2007, there are 365 days, which is equivalent to 52 weeks and 1 day. This means that each day of the week will occur 52 times in a non-leap year, with the remaining day occurring an additional time. Since January 1, 2007 was a Monday, the day that occurs 52 times in 2007 will also be a Monday.

Therefore, Friday, being four days away from Monday, will occur 52 times in the year 2007 as well. So, there are a total of 52 Fridays in the year 2007.
